description: This source file provides utility functions for handling device resources, including retrieving resource details, input parsing, tokenizing command line inputs, and representing resource modes. It appears to be part of a resource management component in a larger device service project.

methods.name: char * getResourceDump(const DSResource * resource)
methods.description: Generates a string representation of a device resource including id, uri, owner info, value, type, and mode.

methods.name: char * getResourceValue(const DSResource * resource)
methods.description: Returns the resource's value, replacing it with an encrypted placeholder if marked as sensitive.

methods.name: char * getInputLine()
methods.description: Reads a line of input from stdin, dynamically reallocating memory as needed, with special handling for EOF.

methods.name: char ** saveToken(char ** args,int numArgs,const char * start,const char * end)
methods.description: Helper function to save a token extracted from input, handling quotes and memory allocation.

methods.name: char ** getTokenizedInput(const char * line,int * numTokens)
methods.description: Splits an input line into tokens, handling quoted strings as single tokens.

methods.name: const char * stringifyMode(uint8_t mode)
methods.description: Converts resource mode flags into a human-readable string representation.

ctags.name: saveToken
ctags.pattern: /^static char **saveToken(char **args, int numArgs, const char *start, const char *end)$/
ctags.signature: (char ** args,int numArgs,const char * start,const char * end)
